about.summary: Contains functions used across packages 'QCA', 'DDIwR', and 'venn'. Interprets and translates SOP - Sum of Products expressions, for both binary and multi-value crisp sets, and extracts information (set names, set values) from those expressions. Other functions perform various other checks if possibly numeric (even if all numbers reside in a character vector) and coerce to numeric, or check if the numbers are whole. It also offers, among others, a highly flexible recoding function.

Contains functions used across packages 'QCA', 'DDIwR', and 'venn'. Interprets and translates SOP - Sum of Products expressions, for both binary and multi-value crisp sets, and extracts information (set names, set values) from those expressions. Other functions perform various other checks if possibly numeric (even if all numbers reside in a character vector) and coerce to numeric, or check if the numbers are whole. It also offers, among others, a highly flexible recoding function.

name: r-admisc
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.38" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-admisc
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/admisc_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/admisc/admisc_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: c827a97677fdae37da13698c7d7674f60bf894b8ba7729d6a3f594765605bc53

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('admisc')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('admisc')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=admisc
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  summary: Contains functions used across packages 'QCA', 'DDIwR', and 'venn'. Interprets and translates SOP - Sum of Products expressions, for both binary and multi-value crisp sets, and extracts information (set names, set values) from those expressions. Other functions perform various other checks if possibly numeric
    (even if all numbers reside in a character vector) and coerce to numeric, or check if the numbers are whole. It also offers, among others, a highly flexible recoding function.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

Other functions perform various other checks if possibly numeric (even if all numbers reside in a character vector) and coerce to numeric, or check if the numbers are whole. It also offers, among others, a highly flexible recoding function.
